examples.query: Show daily cost trend for the last 30 days
examples.sql: SELECT date, SUM(cost) as daily_cost FROM cost_analysis WHERE date >= DATE_SUB(CURRENT_DATE(), INTERVAL 30 DAY) GROUP BY date ORDER BY date
examples.explanation: Daily aggregation of costs for the past 30 days

examples.sql: SELECT EXTRACT(MONTH FROM date) as month, SUM(cost) as monthly_cost FROM cost_analysis WHERE EXTRACT(YEAR FROM date) = EXTRACT(YEAR FROM CURRENT_DATE()) GROUP BY month ORDER BY month
examples.explanation: Monthly cost totals for the current year

examples.sql: SELECT EXTRACT(WEEK FROM date) as week, SUM(cost) as weekly_cost, LAG(SUM(cost)) OVER (ORDER BY EXTRACT(WEEK FROM date)) as prev_week_cost FROM cost_analysis WHERE date >= DATE_SUB(CURRENT_DATE(), INTERVAL 12 WEEK) GROUP BY week ORDER BY week
examples.explanation: Weekly cost totals with previous week comparison using LAG function

examples.query: Cost trend by application over time
examples.sql: SELECT date, application, SUM(cost) as daily_cost FROM cost_analysis WHERE date >= DATE_SUB(CURRENT_DATE(), INTERVAL 90 DAY) GROUP BY date, application ORDER BY date, application
examples.explanation: Multi-dimensional time series showing cost trends per application

examples.sql: SELECT date, SUM(cost) as daily_cost, AVG(SUM(cost)) OVER (ORDER BY date ROWS BETWEEN 6 PRECEDING AND CURRENT ROW) as rolling_7day_avg FROM cost_analysis GROUP BY date ORDER BY date
examples.explanation: Daily costs with 7-day rolling average for trend smoothing
